description:
Canadian cybersecurity startup Protexxa closes a $10 million Series A funding round that brings the total raised to $15 million.

The post Canadian Startup Protexxa Attracts $10 Million Series A Financing appeared first on SecurityWeek.
title: Canadian Startup Protexxa Attracts $10 Million Series A Financing

description:
Google no longer plans on deprecating third-party cookies in Chrome and is working on an updated approach.

The post Google Will Keep Third-Party Cookies in Chrome appeared first on SecurityWeek.
title: Google Will Keep Third-Party Cookies in Chrome

description:
U.S. House leaders are calling on CrowdStrike CEO George Kurtz to testify on widespread tech outage that services around the world.

The post CrowdStrike CEO Called to Testify to Congress Over Cybersecurity Firm’s Role in Global Tech Outage appeared first on SecurityWeek.
title: CrowdStrike CEO Called to Testify to Congress Over Cybersecurity Firm’s Role in Global Tech Outage

description:
CrowdStrike tested a new technique to speed up the remediation of systems impacted by the recent bad update.

The post CrowdStrike Speeding Up Remediation of Systems Hit by Blue Screen of Death appeared first on SecurityWeek.
title: CrowdStrike Speeding Up Remediation of Systems Hit by Blue Screen of Death

description:
The EvilVideo zero-day vulnerability in Telegram for Android allowed threat actors to send malicious files disguised as videos.

The post Telegram Zero-Day Enabled Malware Delivery appeared first on SecurityWeek.
title: Telegram Zero-Day Enabled Malware Delivery

description:
Everything about the Kids Online Safety Act (KOSA): who supports it, who opposes it, and its chances of passing in Congress.

The post What to Know About the Kids Online Safety Act and Its Chances of Passing appeared first on SecurityWeek.
title: What to Know About the Kids Online Safety Act and Its Chances of Passing

description:
Authorities in the UK infiltrated and disrupted the DDoS-for-hire service DigitalStress, and one suspect was arrested.

The post Law Enforcement Disrupts DDoS-for-Hire Service DigitalStress appeared first on SecurityWeek.
title: Law Enforcement Disrupts DDoS-for-Hire Service DigitalStress

description:
The FrostyGoop ICS malware was used recently in an attack against a Ukrainian energy firm that resulted in loss of heating for many buildings.

The post FrostyGoop ICS Malware Left Ukrainian City’s Residents Without Heating appeared first on SecurityWeek.
title: FrostyGoop ICS Malware Left Ukrainian City’s Residents Without Heating

description:
Cloud security giant Wiz will stick to its original plan and pursue an IPO, walking away from a $23 billion deal with Google.

The post Wiz to Pursue IPO as It Walks Away From $23 Billion Google Deal appeared first on SecurityWeek.
title: Wiz to Pursue IPO as It Walks Away From $23 Billion Google Deal
